title.narrative: Strengthening human rights work in East Africa and South Asia

description.narrative: KIOS was founded in 1998 to fund civil society's human rights work in developing countries. Its focus regions are South Asia and East Africa. For the coming programme support period the long term results target of KIOS is defined as follows: Independent hu man rights' movement and organizations' position and opportunities to enhance especially the rights of the persons in vulnerable positions have strengthened in KIOS's focus regions. In order to achieve this results target KIOS intends to strengthen the cap acity of human rights actors and to enhance its focus and interest groups? awareness about human rights work in developing countries. Achieving the goal also supports civil society.The programme implements KIOS?s midterm strategic goals and brings together the projects in different regions and regional programmes by specifying the geographical and thematical focuses. Thus it is easier to strengthen monitor and assess the quality results and and added value of KIOS. The projects will be connected with the co mmunications work and advocacy in Finland and internationally. Besides the project work the programme strengthens the mutual learning communication and joint advocacy work of KIOS and its partner organizations in the Global South. The strong ownership of K IOS?s partner organizations to implement projects and develop their own work is an essential part of the programme. KIOS?s expert role in supporting its partner organizations work for advocacy and networking is emphasized.KIOS?s work is developed by creati ng the regional programmes in East Africa and South Asia. They facilitate the coordination and cooperation of the projects and other activities and enhance achieving the intended strategic goals and wider social change. They also support focused and pri oritized funding.The global level of the programme focuses on advocacy work for and with human rights defenders strengthening human rights work and human rights based approach in the projects and especially enhancing the rights of women and groups in margi nalized positions with communication and advocacy. The regional programmes are also connected with the project work and advocacy.
